intro: Tococa discolor, commonly known as the Amazonian tea plant, is a shrub native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. Its most notable feature is the presence of caffeine in its leaves, similar to that found in coffee. Tococa discolor is often harvested for its leaves, which are used to make a traditional herbal tea.
